snippet: An appeals court ruling dealt a setback to conservation pricing, one of the main tools state regulators want to use to force reductions in urban water use.
abstract: California appeals court rules that tiered water pricing plan being used in Orange County city of San Juan Capistrano violates State Constitution; ruling deals blow to state's regulators, who are entering final steps of carrying out executive order by Gov Jerry Brown imposing 25 percent statewide reduction in urban water use; pricing plan rejected by appeals court, known as conservation pricing, is one of main tools regulators hoped to use.
lead_paragraph: An appeals court ruling dealt a setback to conservation pricing, one of the main tools state regulators want to use to force reductions in urban water use.

headline.main: California Court Rules Water Pricing Plan Violates Law
headline.print_headline: California Court Rules Water Pricing Plan Violates Law
